desc: This course provides intensive exposure to career opportunities in architecture, painting,sculpture, printmaking, ceramics, photography, illustration, video, digital media,anddesign ofall kinds (from toys to exhibitions at the Metropolitan Museum of Art). Workingfivetosevenhours a day, students interview over 25 artist professionals during the month,visitmorethan100 galleries and museums, and write extensively about artists and artwork.Thiscoursedoesnot count toward the major in studio art or art history. Prerequisite: none, but completion of the following courses is highly recommended: ART 253(preferred), ART 252, and ART 280. Offered in alternate years during Interim.
name: New York Art Interim
notes: This is an off-campus course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: none, but completion of the following courses is highly recommended: ART 253(preferred), ART 252, and ART 280. Offered in alternate years during Interim.
